Description: Postcard; printed paper; monochrome (sepia) photograph showing a row of dromedary camels, Egypt.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally unused but message on the back reads: "cleared up & the sun is getting hotter every day now. Well, dear, I think I had better close now. I have been interrupted about 100 times. Remember me to mother, Harry & all. With my very best love & heaps of kisses. Yours ever affectionately, Jack, xxxx xxxx". The first half of the message must have been on another card, and these enclosed in an envelope which is not preserved. The date of the card and message suggests it is from the period of the First World War. The sender is the same as on EPH-ME 2916.
